channel.title: This is more of a java question. Dose the new JDK version support
channel.description: I heard something about the the new JDK version supports strings in the switch statements, and i was wondering if this was true?

item.title: This is more of a java question. Dose the new JDK version support
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

When JDK 7 is released.

Read full topic
item.source: This is more of a java question. Dose the new JDK version support

item.title: This is more of a java question. Dose the new JDK version support
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

That’s how I have my command system set up at them moment, but I was just wondering when I can put strings in a switch statement.

Read full topic
item.source: This is more of a java question. Dose the new JDK version support

item.title: This is more of a java question. Dose the new JDK version support
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:5, topic:266969”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=352483.msg2703515#msg2703515 date=1236806025]

I don’t think so. I heard that will be an addition to JDK 7.

Dang, because i was going to rewrite the command system using switch statements… Simply because it looks better.

I suggest using a HashMap.
[/quote]

That doesn’t look to much cleaner. :S

if( command.containsValue( new Integer(1) ) ){

Something like that? But declaring command as a HashMap?

HashMap command = new HashMap(); command.put( "ziplock", new Integer(1) ); [/quote]
I personally like to create a new class for each command, makes it a lot cleaner.

Read full topic
item.source: This is more of a java question. Dose the new JDK version support

item.title: This is more of a java question. Dose the new JDK version support
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:4, topic:266969”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=352483.msg2703514#msg2703514 date=1236805962]

I don’t think so. I heard that will be an addition to JDK 7.

Dang, because i was going to rewrite the command system using switch statements… Simply because it looks better.
[/quote]
I suggest using a HashMap.[/quote]

That doesn’t look to much cleaner. :S

if( command.containsValue( new Integer(1) ) ){

Something like that? But declaring command as a HashMap?

HashMap command = new HashMap(); 
command.put( "ziplock", new Integer(1) );

Read full topic
